pentamidine_isethionate.name: Pentamidine isethionate
pentamidine_isethionate.warning: Maximum 5 ml per day. Larger doses require specialist evaluation
preparation: Reconstitute each ampoule with 5 mL of water for injections.
Take blood glucose and blood pressure before administration.
Apply the calculated volume IM.
Concomitantly, administer IV 100 to 200 mL of 5% DAD for 30 min.
Observe the patient for 1 hour controlling vital signs and glucometry.
Cite in 48 hours for the next dose.

amphotericin_b_liposomal.name: Amphotericin B Liposomal
presentation: Amphotericin B Liposomal - Blister vial x 50 mg
amphotericin_b_liposomal.warning: Do not exceed 250 mg per day

treatment_time.lv_3mg: Days 1 to 5 and then on days 14 and 21
treatment_time.lv_4mg: Days 1 to 5 and then on days 10, 17, 24, 31 and 38

preparation: Reconstitute each ampoule of Amphotericin B Liposomal with 12 mL of sterile water for injections
Immediately after adding the water, shake the vial vigorously for 30 seconds so that Amphotericin B Liposomal disperses completely.
Visually inspect the vial to confirm that it does not contain particulate material and continue stirring until a complete dispersion is obtained.
Do not use if there is any precipitation of foreign material.
Estimate the number of ampoules to reach {{V1}}.
With a sterile syringe, aspirate {{V1}} of the reconstituted ampoule(s).
Using the 5 μm filter provided, instill the Amphotericin B Liposomal preparation in a sterile container with {{V2}} of DAD 5%.
Manage the total volume {{volumeDose}} in infusion x 1 hour.
Use photoprotective infusion equipment
For the intravenous infusion of Amphotericin B Liposomal, a membrane filter can be used in the infusion line. However, the average diameter of the filter pores should not be less than 1.0 μm.
